segments.text: I see the girl standing there with her hand out, waiting for a cookie like it’s the most normal thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on the boy and the jar that she doesn’t even notice the water spilling everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she’s too young to realize how dangerous this situation is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like it’s nothing, but I can see how unstable it is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice how the girl’s eyes are wide with anticipation, like she’s never seen anything so exciting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll react if the stool tips over and he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink is completely unaware of any of this, and that’s what worries me the most.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water pooling around her feet, and I just know someone is going to slip soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the girl doesn’t get hurt when the inevitable happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a mix of innocence and impending chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR
